parameters: \pop[2]I stand in front of the railing, watching the activity on the dance floor.
\pop[2]It hasn't been too long since I arrived, but I'm starting to feel a sense of home.
\pop[2]There's just something about this place, and these people. I feel at ease.
\pop[2]I'm even able to establish a rapport with people I've never met.
\pop[2]It's like the weight that hindered me back at home was completely eliminated.
\pop[2]This could be a "honeymoon period", of course. But I'm going to enjoy every second.
\pop[2]Klace approaches me, startling me out of my reverie.
This is the first time I've seen you away from the rest of the group.
We're all having a blast, you know. I hope you feel the same way.
\i[5]"Of course. Just needed a breather before I continued."
\i[6]"I was just waiting for someone to come ask me for a dance."
\i[2]"Well it's a lot better, now that I'm alone with you."
\i[0]"Yeah, I was just thinking about home."
\i[5]"Of course. Just needed a breather before I continued."
\pop[4]Oh, good. I was starting to worry.
Things were getting a little intense, I'll give you that.
But I'm glad you're not tapping out. We're just getting started.
\i[6]"I was just waiting for someone to come ask me for a dance."
\pop[4]Well, you might be waiting for a while. The regular patrons can't come up here.
Unless you meant one of \c[14]us\c[0]? You got a crush on one of your friends back there?
Wait; don't answer that. I can't keep a secret to save my life, and that's a warning.
\i[2]"Well it's a lot better, now that I'm alone with you."
\pop[4]Uh, what...? Are you flirting with me?
That's never really been one of my strong suits, Delta.
But I do think you're cool. That's why I decided to come check on you.
\i[0]"Yeah, I was just thinking about home."
\pop[4]Yikes. Now there's a trap you shouldn't get caught in.
Nostalgia is kind of like a broken mirror. Ever heard of that one?
You can recreate the past all you want, but you'll just end up full of cuts.
\pop[2]He gives me a soft smile before taking another sip of his drink.
\pop[2]I thank him for coming over to check on me, and I expect him to leave.
\pop[2]Much to my surprise however, he stays beside me, enjoying my company.
\pop[2]We watch the dance floor together, and I'm a little flattered.
\pop[2]Someone of his status choosing to spend time with me...?
\pop[2]As that thought consumes my mind, I can't help but ask him.
\pop[4]Status? And what status do you mean, exactly?
People say that all the time, but they have no idea what this industry is like.
I can guarantee that you'd outrank me tenfold if we compared our scores.
\pop[4]People like me -- artists, I mean; are known for having awful scores.
Art has always been about challenging the status quo. At least, to me.
\c[23]The System\c[0] hates that, and every new song is a nosedive for my score.
\pop[2]I tell him that I'm not talking about \c[23]The System\c[0].
\pop[2]I'm talking about his fame and fortune as a popstar.
\pop[2]However, I'm a bit surprised that his score is low.
\pop[4]Oh jeeze. Now I'm embarrassed for going off on a tangent.
Whenever somebody mentions status, I always think about \c[23]The System\c[0].
We're just numbers in a computer. Fame and fortune will always come second to that.
\pop[2]He takes another sip of his drink.
\pop[4]It goes against my values to treat one group of people better than another, too.
So this status that you're talking about? It's from the outside, looking in.
When I watch you and your friends, I'm actually pretty jealous.
\pop[2]He's envious of us...? I ask him to elaborate.
\pop[4]At this point, I think the alcohol is elaborating -- not me.
But everybody dancing down there? I bet they wish they could be up here.
They'd probably even abandon their friends and family for a life of luxury.
\pop[4]And by the time they regret it, it'd already be too late.
Once you get into a world like this, there's no getting out.
You're just... there. Watching them, and wanting to go back.
\pop[4]You know, I could tell that you and your friends were worried.
It was clear. You didn't really know if you'd fit in with me or not.
But honestly, I was terrified that I wouldn't fit in with \c[14]you\c[0].
\pop[4]I said I wanted to have a good time, and now I'm bringing you down.
Let's make a deal, alright? Drop the whole "status" thing between us.
That's not something I can ask of \c[14]them\c[0], but I know I can ask it of you.
\pop[2]He motions down toward the dance floor, and I understand what he means.
\pop[2]Especially now that people are starting to recognize his face.
\pop[2]They look up from the dance floor, taking pictures of us.
\pop[4]Just like they want to be up here; I want to be down there.
That velvet rope keeps me in just as much as it keeps them out.
"For my safety", they always say. Like I can't take care of myself.
\pop[4]But I hope that you and your friends can change that.
I don't have to be up here alone anymore. I can be with all of \c[14]you\c[0].
Hold on. Let me get this over with. It's rude to keep an audience hanging.
\pop[2]He leans over the railing a little bit, blowing a kiss to the crowd.
\pop[2]With a smile, and little pose for the photos, it seems like his work is done.
\pop[2]They cheer, but it's peculiar; like his personality changed just for the crowd.
\pop[4]Well then, let's get away from all those prying eyes.
If I'm not mistaken, you owe me a few facts about yourself.
\pop[2]I nod, and follow him back to the core area of the VIP deck.
\pop[2]We sit down across from each other, and he leans back, stretching.
\pop[2]Dante, Taylor, and Isaac are still hanging out. Their distance provides us with privacy.
\pop[2]He rests his empty glass on the table between us, and then stares at me.
\pop[2]I can tell he's trying to get a read on me. Like he can tell just from sight.
\pop[2]With a quick shrug, I rest back in my chair, and wait for him to speak.
Maybe it's because we're both fish out of water, here.
Lost and clueless, but lost and clueless together, right?
\pop[2]Another smile. I give him one in return.
\pop[2]Bonding over a shared struggle makes sense to me.
\pop[2]It's not easy moving to a place you know almost nothing about.
I know your friends are here; and Isaac offered you a room, but yeah.
Running away from something? Looking for something new?
\pop[2]I tell him that it's a mix of both, honestly.
\pop[2]At home, I felt held back. I needed a big change, and more freedom.
\pop[2]I also don't know what I want in life, so I guess it's an excuse to "find myself".
\pop[4]Find yourself? I've been there, and it's not really what you'd think.
Sometimes finding yourself just means realizing how \c[14]lost\c[0] you really are.
In the face of something like that, blissful ignorance almost seems preferable.
\pop[2]It might just be the alcohol, but that sounded rather profound.
\pop[2]Klace immediately leans forward, giggling at what he said.
\pop[4]I am \c[14]so\c[0] putting that in my next song.
Look -- we just met, and you're already inspiring me!
Let's have another drink, alright? I like where this is going.
\pop[2]He quickly scurries to the bar, and prepares two glasses of wine.
\pop[2]Carefully walking back, he tries his best not to spill anything.
\pop[2]Sitting down with a smile, he places the drinks on the table.
\pop[4]Thanks for opening up to me, by the way.
It's enough to know your reasoning. I shouldn't pry for specifics.
If I keep making you talk about your past, you'll never move on from it.
\pop[4]So let's have a drink to the future, alright?
And not the \c[17]Komorebi\c[0], but the future we make for ourselves.
No need to base our lives on all that metaphysical nonsense.
\pop[2]I raise my glass, and we drink in sync with one another.
\pop[2]However, when we put the glasses down, I have to come clean.
\pop[2]This is when I let him know that I've never experienced \c[17]Komorebi\c[0].
From what I've seen, people like you live happier lives.
I've never understood all that counselor nonsense.
\pop[2]I totally agree, and thank him for his point of view.
\pop[2]If anything, it seems like the remnants of a dead system.
\pop[2]People our age have long since come to terms with \c[17]Komorebi\c[0].
\pop[2]But while we're on the subject, I had to ask him.
\pop[2]What did he see in his vision? Did he see his fame and fortune?
\pop[2]I know he had songs in his head, but what else did he glean?
\pop[2]He immediately looks taken aback, and his ears perk up.
\pop[2]He looks worried, and blushes softly as he adjusts his scarf.
\pop[2]Such a mixed reaction. I can't tell if I did something bad or not.
\pop[4]That's a "third date" kind of conversation, you know.
But I doubt this is the last time we'll be hanging out together.
Just put that one on the back-burner. At least for now, please.
\i[2]"Does that mean we can count this as our first date?"
\i[2]"Does that mean we can count this as our first date?"
\pop[4]Smooth. But actually, I'm not really allowed to date.
They say a single guy gets more attention from the fans.
I know they're really after money, but I can't exactly fight the label.
\pop[4]Thanks. You're really considerate. I don't see that too often.
Before my hiatus, they wouldn't let me make friends, or even date anybody.
They said that a single guy gets more attention, and I should focus on my career.
\pop[2]Wait. The industry controls his personal life? That doesn't sound good.
\pop[2]Although it does explain why his social skills are rough around the edges.
\pop[2]If this is really his first group of friends, then I'm glad to be a part of it.
\pop[4]I keep forgetting that I'm not bound by their rules during this hiatus.
Like, I know I am, but it hasn't really "registered" in my head yet?
They gave me this little break in order to seal a deal in the making.
\pop[4]Yeah. After this break, I owe them five albums over ten years.
My last contract ran its course, so I actually had ground to negotiate.
I'm giving them so much of my life, I guess I just wanted some of it back in return.
\pop[2]There's something about all of this that seems so depressing.
\pop[2]He's able to say it with a smile, however. Like it's "normal" to him.
\pop[4]But I know that during this break, I'll make bonds that last a lifetime.
The next ten years will be nothing if I have all of you by my side.
I \c[14]was\c[0] worried; but now I have some much needed backup.
\pop[2]We both smile at each other, and he blushes once more.
\pop[2]I couldn't put my finger on it, but that seemed like the perfect end to our talk.
\pop[2]Both standing up at the same time, it was almost like that feeling was mutual.
\pop[2]It seems as if we're both in sync.
\pop[2]Like he said before -- fish out of water.
\pop[2]Holding out his glass, he simply repeats the earlier saying.
\pop[2]As I say that, I tap my glass against his.
\pop[2]With a quick smile, he returns to the rest of the group.
